issue.title: mytotalconnectcomfort.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://mytotalconnectcomfort.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmytotalconnectcomfort.com) ### Comment > This is the site I use to control my thermostat in my home so I need it to be working. I've been through extensive troubleshooting to fix this over the past few weeks and I had to take my computer to a specialist for $80 to determine that the issue is caused by AdGuard. I didn't think it was initially because I disabled AdGuard on this site and it still wouldn't load. However, he pointed out that if I completely exit AdGuard, then the site will load properly. My screenshots are of AdGuard still running on my computer, but with it disabled on the site, and the site will not load with "ERROR_CONNECTION_CLOSED". The second screenshot is after completely exiting AdGuard and not allowing it to run in the background and the site works normally. ``` Username: @JackLGM ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/5utfr3dywvocowow4g4gckw4ogoswkodlb2yh749tc.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/oyua20ko00g8o8880oko8sc4koc0wo0izgbu4ci99c.png?nc=1)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1q97_mHlftpECOGTbnrVqyuIOr19rRuqyUZnN3HXgQwI/edit?pli=1&gid=497241817#gid=497241817](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.google.com%2Fspreadsheets%2Fd%2F1q97_mHlftpECOGTbnrVqyuIOr19rRuqyUZnN3HXgQwI%2Fedit%3Fpli%3D1%26gid%3D497241817%23gid%3D497241817) ### Comment > Every time I enter anything in Google docs or Google sheets and either switch tabs in the browser window or navigate to another window to check something, your extension DELETES the last few minutes worth of work from the doc or sheet. It's infuriating. And bizarre. I have turned off access to docs and sheets, it still happens. The only way to stop it is to completely disable your extension. Not cool! Also, not sharing a pic of a Google sheet that has info deleted because it won't help you, and would be a HIPAA violation. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/stmlw2esvascks4ookscs0sc0g4scgc7t8b8vdip2o.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/so7vrkjiqxw4gw084kscs40o80w4oc41aa0067quac.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser Extension v5.2.800.9 MV3 System version: | `Chromium OS 14541.0.0` Browser: | Chrome Tracking protection: | disabled Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base

Other:
Filter unblocking search ads and self-promotion Filters last update: | December 29, 2025 at 12:00 Other extensions used: | `None. I deleted everything else trying to figure out what was causing the problem. This extension deletes data on Google sheets and Google docs, restoring to an earlier point. It's unusable on any computer where people need to use the GSuite. Not cool!` ### Issue configuration [Import](https://reports.adguard.com/settings/import.html?product_type=ext&product_version=5.2.800.9&system_version=Chromium+OS+14541.0.0&manifest_version=3&browser=chrome&filters=2.10&browsing_security.statistics_enabled=false&stealth.enabled=false&filters_last_update=2025-12-29T12%3A00%3A41)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://mytotalconnectcomfort.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmytotalconnectcomfort.com) ### Comment > This is the site I use to control my thermostat in my home so I need it to be working. I've been through extensive troubleshooting to fix this over the past few weeks and I had to take my computer to a specialist for $80 to determine that the issue is caused by AdGuard. I didn't think it was initially because I disabled AdGuard on this site and it still wouldn't load. However, he pointed out that if I completely exit AdGuard, then the site will load properly. My screenshots are of AdGuard still running on my computer, but with it disabled on the site, and the site will not load with "ERROR_CONNECTION_CLOSED". The second screenshot is after completely exiting AdGuard and not allowing it to run in the background and the site works normally. ``` Username: @JackLGM ``` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
@JackLGM In the meantime, can you add these as custom rules and see whether the issue comes back?

```adblock
@@||mytotalconnectcomfort.com^$stealth=3p-cookie
@@*$stealth=searchqueries,domain=mytotalconnectcomfort.com
@@*$stealth=webrtc,domain=mytotalconnectcomfort.com
```

issue.title: m.naver.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://m.naver.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fm.naver.com)
### Comment
> Hello, this is the Naver Development Team.
> 
> One of our team members previously contacted AdGuard support regarding an issue with Naver services when using AdGuard DNS, reporting that Android users with AdGuard DNS (dns.adguard.com) cannot access naver.com domains. We received confirmation from AdGuard support that naver.com domains are not blocked.
> 
> As a follow-up, we would like to provide additional details about the ongoing issue.
> 
> **Issue Overview:**
> We have recently received numerous reports from customers experiencing difficulties accessing Naver-related services through Android apps (Chrome, Google app, Naver app, etc.) when using AdGuard DNS. Based on customer inquiries and internal reproduction tests, we have confirmed that this issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS in conjunction with LG U+, a major network provider in South Korea.
> 
> **Symptoms:**
> * Various Naver services (Naver Search, Naver Shopping, Naver News, etc.) are inaccessible or fail to load properly
>   > For example, when accessing "m.naver.com" through mobile Chrome or Google app, users encounter errors such as "Unable to connect to the Internet" or "This site can't be reached"
>   > Web pages fail to load in browser apps, displaying ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED errors
> * The issue is primarily reported by Android users
> * The problem occurs intermittently (not continuously), sometimes lasting several minutes
> * Our internal testing confirms the issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS with the LG U+ network
>   > Configuration: Phone Settings > Connections > More connection settings > Private DNS > dns.adguard-dns.com (or dns.adguard.com)
> 
> **Actions Taken:**
> The Naver development team has contacted the LG U+ network team to investigate this issue further. We are reaching out to request AdGuard's cooperation as well, as this appears to be an interaction between AdGuard DNS and the LG U+ network that is affecting our users' ability to access Naver services.
> 
> We appreciate your assistance in resolving this matter.

### Screenshots

  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

</details>

</details>

  <summary>Screenshot 4 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 4](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/eqnqnc2iq8g8g04cw8o0ksogcg8gg48lnokjgnjwzk.jpg?nc=1)
</details>

  <summary>Screenshot 5 </summary>

comment.body:
Cannot reproduce even if I enable the provided all filters lists subscribed by the reporter.
 Please check that Safari content blockers of Adguard for iOS are enabled. And, you disable Safari content blockers by touching a menu in Safari toolbar.

issue.title: temu.com: Privacy / URL parameters

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

URLs like

https://www.temu.com/gr/kuiper/un3.html?subj=dpa-un&_bg_fs=1&_p_jump_id=543&_x_vst_scene=adg&goods_id=id&sku_id=id2&adg_ctx=a&_p_rfs=a&_x_ads_channel=a&_x_ads_creative_id=a&_x_ads_id=a&_x_ads_set=a&_x_ads_sub_channel=a&_x_ns_catalog_id=a&_x_ns_gid=a&_x_ns_placement=a&_x_ns_product_id=a&_x_ns_site_id=a&_x_ns_source=a&mrk_rec=a&_x_ns_crt_id=a&_x_bg_adid=a&_x_from=a&_x_ads_account=a&utm_medium=a&utm_source=a&utm_id=a&utm_content=a&utm_term=a&utm_campaign=a&fbclid=a

are what Facebook ads redirect to when clicked. However, I have verified that 

https://www.temu.com/gr/kuiper/un3.html?subj=dpa-un&_bg_fs=1&_p_jump_id=543&_x_vst_scene=adg&goods_id=id&sku_id=id2

is enough to navigate to the destination.

Therefore, _solution_ could be added to the appropriate list

### Proposed solution

```abp
! 2026-01-04 https://www.temu.com
temu.com$removeparam=adg_ctx
temu.com$removeparam=_p_rfs
temu.com$removeparam=_x_ads_channel
temu.com$removeparam=_x_ads_creative_id
temu.com$removeparam=_x_ads_id
temu.com$removeparam=_x_ads_set
temu.com$removeparam=_x_ads_sub_channel
temu.com$removeparam=_x_ns_catalog_id
temu.com$removeparam=_x_ns_gid
temu.com$removeparam=_x_ns_placement
temu.com$removeparam=_x_ns_product_id
temu.com$removeparam=_x_ns_site_id
temu.com$removeparam=_x_ns_source
temu.com$removeparam=mrk_rec
temu.com$removeparam=_x_ns_crt_id
temu.com$removeparam=_x_bg_adid
temu.com$removeparam=_x_from
temu.com$removeparam=_x_ads_account
temu.com$removeparam=utm_medium
temu.com$removeparam=utm_source
temu.com$removeparam=utm_id
temu.com$removeparam=utm_content
temu.com$removeparam=utm_term
temu.com$removeparam=utm_campaign
temu.com$removeparam=fbclid
```

### Additional information

https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uAssets/issues/31394

issue.title: m.naver.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://m.naver.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fm.naver.com)
### Comment
> Hello, this is the Naver Development Team.
> 
> One of our team members previously contacted AdGuard support regarding an issue with Naver services when using AdGuard DNS, reporting that Android users with AdGuard DNS (dns.adguard.com) cannot access naver.com domains. We received confirmation from AdGuard support that naver.com domains are not blocked.
> 
> As a follow-up, we would like to provide additional details about the ongoing issue.
> 
> **Issue Overview:**
> We have recently received numerous reports from customers experiencing difficulties accessing Naver-related services through Android apps (Chrome, Google app, Naver app, etc.) when using AdGuard DNS. Based on customer inquiries and internal reproduction tests, we have confirmed that this issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS in conjunction with LG U+, a major network provider in South Korea.
> 
> **Symptoms:**
> * Various Naver services (Naver Search, Naver Shopping, Naver News, etc.) are inaccessible or fail to load properly
>   > For example, when accessing "m.naver.com" through mobile Chrome or Google app, users encounter errors such as "Unable to connect to the Internet" or "This site can't be reached"
>   > Web pages fail to load in browser apps, displaying ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED errors
> * The issue is primarily reported by Android users
> * The problem occurs intermittently (not continuously), sometimes lasting several minutes
> * Our internal testing confirms the issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS with the LG U+ network
>   > Configuration: Phone Settings > Connections > More connection settings > Private DNS > dns.adguard-dns.com (or dns.adguard.com)
> 
> **Actions Taken:**
> The Naver development team has contacted the LG U+ network team to investigate this issue further. We are reaching out to request AdGuard's cooperation as well, as this appears to be an interaction between AdGuard DNS and the LG U+ network that is affecting our users' ability to access Naver services.
> 
> We appreciate your assistance in resolving this matter.

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/l12z5xty3tsk004k8000skoks8w80wsb2r994pz5r4.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 2 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/16ho0xijiiw0g4w8gookogko4g4ss0kphwb4855j00.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 3 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 3](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/sy801lsz4000s8c0s0wgkwcc4s0wcg4dje2wixxao0.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 4 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 4](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/eqnqnc2iq8g8g04cw8o0ksogcg8gg48lnokjgnjwzk.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 5 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 5](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/iadqmo6ipq0wocgkcwggs8o0k8ggk40tpgtxpyimsg.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/oljxujs1sn4w8swck4okwgow4ssswk0e96d8hnp0f4.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 2 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/tkvknvqico0gw4880gs0kcokg444woseo1nz2b8zfc.jpg?nc=1)
</details>

  ![Screenshot 3](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/6s32hb49exgc48k8kcowg04ogowgcowbz4xhkisev4.jpg?nc=1)
</details>

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: m.naver.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://m.naver.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fm.naver.com)
### Comment
> Hello, this is the Naver Development Team.
> 
> One of our team members previously contacted AdGuard support regarding an issue with Naver services when using AdGuard DNS, reporting that Android users with AdGuard DNS (dns.adguard.com) cannot access naver.com domains. We received confirmation from AdGuard support that naver.com domains are not blocked.
> 
> As a follow-up, we would like to provide additional details about the ongoing issue.
> 
> **Issue Overview:**
> We have recently received numerous reports from customers experiencing difficulties accessing Naver-related services through Android apps (Chrome, Google app, Naver app, etc.) when using AdGuard DNS. Based on customer inquiries and internal reproduction tests, we have confirmed that this issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS in conjunction with LG U+, a major network provider in South Korea.
> 
> **Symptoms:**
> * Various Naver services (Naver Search, Naver Shopping, Naver News, etc.) are inaccessible or fail to load properly
>   > For example, when accessing "m.naver.com" through mobile Chrome or Google app, users encounter errors such as "Unable to connect to the Internet" or "This site can't be reached"
>   > Web pages fail to load in browser apps, displaying ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED errors
> * The issue is primarily reported by Android users
> * The problem occurs intermittently (not continuously), sometimes lasting several minutes
> * Our internal testing confirms the issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS with the LG U+ network
>   > Configuration: Phone Settings > Connections > More connection settings > Private DNS > dns.adguard-dns.com (or dns.adguard.com)
> 
> **Actions Taken:**
> The Naver development team has contacted the LG U+ network team to investigate this issue further. We are reaching out to request AdGuard's cooperation as well, as this appears to be an interaction between AdGuard DNS and the LG U+ network that is affecting our users' ability to access Naver services.
> 
> We appreciate your assistance in resolving this matter.

### Screenshots

</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 4 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 4](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/eqnqnc2iq8g8g04cw8o0ksogcg8gg48lnokjgnjwzk.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>

issue.title: m.naver.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://m.naver.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fm.naver.com)
### Comment
> Hello, this is the Naver Development Team.
> 
> One of our team members previously contacted AdGuard support regarding an issue with Naver services when using AdGuard DNS, reporting that Android users with AdGuard DNS (dns.adguard.com) cannot access naver.com domains. We received confirmation from AdGuard support that naver.com domains are not blocked.
> 
> As a follow-up, we would like to provide additional details about the ongoing issue.
> 
> **Issue Overview:**
> We have recently received numerous reports from customers experiencing difficulties accessing Naver-related services through Android apps (Chrome, Google app, Naver app, etc.) when using AdGuard DNS. Based on customer inquiries and internal reproduction tests, we have confirmed that this issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS in conjunction with LG U+, a major network provider in South Korea.
> 
> **Symptoms:**
> * Various Naver services (Naver Search, Naver Shopping, Naver News, etc.) are inaccessible or fail to load properly
>   > For example, when accessing "m.naver.com" through mobile Chrome or Google app, users encounter errors such as "Unable to connect to the Internet" or "This site can't be reached"
>   > Web pages fail to load in browser apps, displaying ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED errors
> * The issue is primarily reported by Android users
> * The problem occurs intermittently (not continuously), sometimes lasting several minutes
> * Our internal testing confirms the issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS with the LG U+ network
>   > Configuration: Phone Settings > Connections > More connection settings > Private DNS > dns.adguard-dns.com (or dns.adguard.com)
> 
> **Actions Taken:**
> The Naver development team has contacted the LG U+ network team to investigate this issue further. We are reaching out to request AdGuard's cooperation as well, as this appears to be an interaction between AdGuard DNS and the LG U+ network that is affecting our users' ability to access Naver services.
> 
> We appreciate your assistance in resolving this matter.

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/l12z5xty3tsk004k8000skoks8w80wsb2r994pz5r4.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 2 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/16ho0xijiiw0g4w8gookogko4g4ss0kphwb4855j00.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 3 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 3](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/sy801lsz4000s8c0s0wgkwcc4s0wcg4dje2wixxao0.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 4 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 4](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/eqnqnc2iq8g8g04cw8o0ksogcg8gg48lnokjgnjwzk.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 5 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 5](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/iadqmo6ipq0wocgkcwggs8o0k8ggk40tpgtxpyimsg.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/oljxujs1sn4w8swck4okwgow4ssswk0e96d8hnp0f4.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 2 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/tkvknvqico0gw4880gs0kcokg444woseo1nz2b8zfc.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 3 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 3](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/6s32hb49exgc48k8kcowg04ogowgcowbz4xhkisev4.jpg?nc=1)
</details>

### System configuration

DNS setup: | Device or router settings

System version: | `Android 16`
Browser: | Chrome

comment.body:
Thank you for letting me know. I've revoked the Google Drive sharing links.

While we continue to investigate this issue internally, please feel free to reach out if you have any questions or need additional details.

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://workflow.idocs.kz/documents/c1a4b5a0-c95c-435c-d6ba-08de4cce928f](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fworkflow.idocs.kz%2Fdocuments%2Fc1a4b5a0-c95c-435c-d6ba-08de4cce928f) ### Comment > при включенном приложении, и выключенным расширением - не открывается. При отключении блокировки рекламы - загружается сама страница - но функционал не полностью (подписание эцп). > При полной остановке фильтрацией приложения - все работает. ### Screenshots

Block trackers,
Strip URLs from tracking parameters,
Hide your search queries,
Send Do-Not-Track header

**Tracking methods**:

**Browser API**:
Block Push API,

**Miscellaneous**:
Hide your IP address (208.54.104.184),

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://mytotalconnectcomfort.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmytotalconnectcomfort.com) ### Comment > This is the site I use to control my thermostat in my home so I need it to be working. I've been through extensive troubleshooting to fix this over the past few weeks and I had to take my computer to a specialist for $80 to determine that the issue is caused by AdGuard. I didn't think it was initially because I disabled AdGuard on this site and it still wouldn't load. However, he pointed out that if I completely exit AdGuard, then the site will load properly. My screenshots are of AdGuard still running on my computer, but with it disabled on the site, and the site will not load with "ERROR_CONNECTION_CLOSED". The second screenshot is after completely exiting AdGuard and not allowing it to run in the background and the site works normally. ``` Username: @JackLGM ``` ### Screenshots

Sent: Monday, January 5, 2026 9:24 PM
To: AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters ***@***.***>
Cc: JackLGM ***@***.***>; Mention ***@***.***>
Subject: Re: [AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters] mytotalconnectcomfort.com (Issue #221469)

 

  <https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/23257168?s=20&v=4> ntnguyen1234 left a comment (AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters#221469) <https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/221469#issuecomment-3712957802>

@@*$stealth=webrtc,domain=mytotalconnectcomfort.com

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://lampa.mx_cub.red_cub.rip](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Flampa.mx_cub.red_cub.rip) ### Comment > Вводные: > Дано: > Смартфон с Android 13 + установлено положение Lampa (не помню откуда скачивал apk для установки lampa) (cub.red) + установлено Adguard for Android (последняя версия). > > В лампе установлен плагин онлайн просмотра https://nb557.github.io/plugins/online_mod.js > При включенной защити Adguard (возможно связано включенной dns-защитой) в этом плагине отламывается функционал авторизации в HDREZKA и изменяется сам внешний вид авторизации. Без авторизации просмотр с балансера HDREZKA невозможна. Если отключить защиту вид настройки меняется, появляется пункт "заполнить куки для HDREZKA", после ввода логина/пароля заполняются эти куки и происходит вход в аккаунт HDREZKA и доступ к просмотру. > > Также при включении защиты режутся некоторые настройки плеера в приложении (выбор встроенного в приложение плеера или плеера Android. Пропадает пункт "закрыть приложение" из главного окна настроек. > > по наблюдением, adguard чего то ломает, из-за чего lampa для Android считает себя веб версией, которая запускается в любом браузере вводом адреса lampa.mx. В следствии этого отсутствуют все настройки присущие Android (выбор вместо встроенного плеера lampa любого плеера установленного на Android) ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/emwvji1sjzsw880kowsoskw0oo0woc0foerk5jhgm0.jpg?nc=1)

Screenshot 2 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/li8mvqj44q8swwwgcc8c440wokoc4041vo0ngnuzzb.jpg?nc=1)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://lampa.mx_cub.red_cub.rip](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Flampa.mx_cub.red_cub.rip) ### Comment > Вводные: > Дано: > Смартфон с Android 13 + установлено положение Lampa (не помню откуда скачивал apk для установки lampa) (cub.red) + установлено Adguard for Android (последняя версия). > > В лампе установлен плагин онлайн просмотра https://nb557.github.io/plugins/online_mod.js > При включенной защити Adguard (возможно связано включенной dns-защитой) в этом плагине отламывается функционал авторизации в HDREZKA и изменяется сам внешний вид авторизации. Без авторизации просмотр с балансера HDREZKA невозможна. Если отключить защиту вид настройки меняется, появляется пункт "заполнить куки для HDREZKA", после ввода логина/пароля заполняются эти куки и происходит вход в аккаунт HDREZKA и доступ к просмотру. > > Также при включении защиты режутся некоторые настройки плеера в приложении (выбор встроенного в приложение плеера или плеера Android. Пропадает пункт "закрыть приложение" из главного окна настроек. > > по наблюдением, adguard чего то ломает, из-за чего lampa для Android считает себя веб версией, которая запускается в любом браузере вводом адреса lampa.mx. В следствии этого отсутствуют все настройки присущие Android (выбор вместо встроенного плеера lampa любого плеера установленного на Android) ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/emwvji1sjzsw880kowsoskw0oo0woc0foerk5jhgm0.jpg?nc=1)

Screenshot 2 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/li8mvqj44q8swwwgcc8c440wokoc4041vo0ngnuzzb.jpg?nc=1)

comment.body:
I'm not the original reporter for the above, but I'm a user of the `https://dns.adguard-dns.com/dns-query` DNS. The issue goes away the moment I change DNS.

Would like to add that all UOB bank related sites seem to be affected:
- https://www.uob.com.sg/
- https://www.uobgroup.com/
- https://pib.uob.com.sg/

UOB is one of the major banks in Singapore and should not be blocked.

Hoping to be of some help, it still does not work for me. Besides AdGuard I have NoScript filter active and as you can see below, it blocks a Facebook page. I never ever had a Facebook account activated (I'm actually off all the "social" networks) and I wonder if this could be the reason for the blocking. See screenshot attached.
Thanks for your kind support.
